QAndAs.question: What are Kava and Hard? Are they blockchains? How are they related?
answers: Kava Chain is a decentralized, permissionless, censorship-resistant blockchain built with the Cosmos SDK. This means it operates much like other Cosmos ecosystem blockchains. Learn more
Kava Protocol is the set of rules and behaviors baked into the Kava Chain that enables advanced Decentralized Finance (DeFi) functionality like permissionless borrowing and lending.

Hard Protocol is an application that runs on Kava Chain. It does not have its own blockchain. It builds upon the Kava Protocol and adds new functionality, expanding the Kava Ecosystem to include an autonomous money market protocol.

Kava Chain is a decentralized, permissionless, censorship-resistant blockchain built with the Cosmos SDK. This means it operates much like other Cosmos ecosystem blockchains. Learn more

  • KAVA and HARD are governance tokens, meaning holders can vote on the rules of the protocols (HARD governance is coming in kava v.5.0).
  • KAVA is also used as a Proof of Stake staking asset, which ensures the finality and safety of loans on the protocol and also acts as the ‘lender of last resort’ in certain situations.
  • USDX is a stable coin loosely pegged to the US Dollar. It is created in Kava CDPs.

Non-native assets: Other tokens can also be issued on Kava Chain. These non-native asset tokens are often used to ‘wrap’, ‘tokenize’ or represent assets on other chains.

  • For example, Binance Coin (BNB) can be represented as a token on Kava Chain. During a cross-chain swap, BNB(Kava) coins are created or destroyed(burned) on Kava Chain, and frozen/unfrozen on Binance Chain.
  • Assets from other blockchains are all non-native assets. This includes coins from other Cosmos ecosystem blockchains, which can connect to Kava Chain through protocols like Cosmos IBC.
  • Be aware, KAVA(native) has been tokenized on other blockchains, namely Binance Chain. KAVA(Binance BEP-2) is a token that exists solely on Binance Chain. Do not send KAVA(Binance BEP-2) directly to Kava Chain!
  • BTCB - represents BTC on Binance Chain, then we represent BTCB on Kava. called BTCBK? Wrapped? Tokenized? is it BTCB or BTCBK?
Kava Labs is the team/company that develops and maintains Kava Protocol and Hard Protocol.
The Kava Platform or Kava Web App, which is live at kava.io, is a user-friendly hub for interacting with the protocol. Similarly, the Hard Platform or Hard Web App can be found at hard.kava.io.
Best introductory reading: Kava, Hard.

QAndAs.question: Does Kava have smart contracts? What is a CDP? Are my coins held in a smart contract?
answers: Like most Cosmos ecosystem blockchains, the automated transaction behaviors known as smart contracts on other blockchains are hardcoded into the core protocol itself.

A CDP or Collateralized Debt Position is a new kind of automated loan contract, used to create ‘stable coins' that are pegged to a popular currency like the US Dollar. The lender puts up a crypto asset as collateral to ‘mint’, or create new stable coins. For example, on Kava, users often put up BNB coin to mint USDX. The collateral is locked while the position is open. The lender can only get the collateral back once they return the loan amount, with interest. The lender can only take out 2/3rds of the collateral amount, so if they have supplied 100 dollars worth of BNB (based on current BNB price), they can mint up to 66 dollars of USDX. Lenders must keep in mind that if the price of the collateral asset drops too low, their CDP could be liquidated. Therefore it is advised not to mint more than 1/2 of the value of the collateral. learn more (from a defi blog) learn more..(links to MakerDao, so internal use only)

QAndAs.question: Where did my coins go? Deputy issue transferring from Kava to Binance chain. What is the deal with the hot wallet balance?
answers:
Can’t find my coins:

  • Possibilities:

Do not worry, your coins will not be lost. Every cross-chain swap has an auditable record. Previously some transactions through the deputy took a long time to go through, but that should be resolved with recent updates. If you encounter this issue please wait patiently. If your transaction has not completed after 24 hours please contact the Kava team and send us the transaction ID.

To operate cross-chain swaps, Binance must allocate a certain amount of funds to be available for transfers. This requires that the funds are in a hot wallet. As a security measure, Binance needs to periodically manually refill the hot wallet. Besides that, everything else in the cross-chain swap is completely automated.
